alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 13 at 2:45PM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, with local amounts up to 8 inches possible. Dangerous wind chills of 30 to 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon County including Rawlins, Saratoga, Baggs, and Shirley Basin. * WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory from 11 PM MST this evening until 11 AM MST Monday. Wind Chill Warning until 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow covered roads and low visibilities in falling snow. Dangerously cold wind chills could may lead to frostbite on exposed skin in as as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to fall in two separate waves. The first wave will occur from late tonight through late Sunday morning. After a brief lull, a second round of accumulating snow is expected from Sunday evening through mid day Monday. Total expected snow accumulations include both waves.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
